intro: Tagetes pseudomicrantha, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its vibrant orange and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and disc florets, typical of the family, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Tagetes pseudomicrantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
